frameDefinitions: The words in this frame describe an Experiencer's emotions with respect to some Content.
This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.
A Cognizer thinks of and performs an Action that is a self- or other-imposed task or some other kind of desirable behavior.
A Cognizer calls up an episodic memory of past Experience or an Impression of a Salient_entity formed  on the basis of past experience.
This frame concerns a Cognizer's certainty about the correctness of beliefs  or expectations.
A Cognizer retains facts in memory and is able to retrieve them.
frameExamples: My <t>enjoyment</t> of the movie was considerably impaired by the seven-foot guy sitting in front of me.
Dad <t>taught</t> me that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens.
You invited everybody but you <t>forgot</t> Harry.
Kozmo could <t>remember</t> when his modem was the fastest he could buy.
Lermontov was <t>certain</t> he would come to the party.
I was impressed that she 'd actually <t>remembered</t> Radish 's name (= what Radish's name is)
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the emotion or other internal state.

<fen>Content</fen> is what the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s feelings or experiences are directed towards or based upon.  The <fen>Content</fen> differs from a stimulus because the <fen>Content</fen> is not construed as being direcly responsible for causing the emotion.

The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflect his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the area about which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has the particular experience.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
The time at which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in the specified emotional state.
One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.
One who is instructed by a <fen>Teacher</fen> in skills or knowledge.
An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or to a <fen>Student</fen>.
A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
An action which the <fen>Student</fen> is able to perform as a result of instruction.
A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
A piece of information that the <fen>Student</fen> is informed of by the <fen>Teacher</fen>.
Educational <fen>Material</fen>, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or a <fen>Student</fen> to acquire skills or knowledge.
A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the <fen>Student</fen> is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject
The time when the teaching occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the teaching takes place.

Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
The person who thinks of or fails to think of an obligatory or desireable <fen>Action</fen>.
An <fen>Action</fen> that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is supposed to carry out. This may be a Task imposed specifically on the <fen>Cognizer</fen> or it may be self- or socially imposed.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is a person or thing that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> needs to affect or effect when carrying out the <fen>Action</fen>.
A <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers or fails to carry out an <fen>Action</fen>.
A person who recalls memories of past experience or impressions.
A person or thing that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers as being involved in some state or event or as having some property.
A past event or state that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> witnessed and is now recalling. The <fen>Experience</fen> may be a specific event or state or a vaguer period that is treated as a unit.

A property that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> attributes to the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> based on their past experience of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> or a category to which the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is assigned.
A property or role that a <fen>Salient_entity</fen> actually held and which frames the memories that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers the experience.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose certainty or uncertainty is at issue.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the entity that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a certain/uncertain belief about.
The <fen>Content</fen> denotes the mental content that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain or uncertain about.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the mental state of  the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The person who retains and retrieves information.
<fen>Mental_content</fen> stored by and accessible to the <fen>Cognizer</fen>. It may derive from experience or activity or simply from being informed of it.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> retrieves <fen>Mental_content</fen> or forgets it.
listRoleExamples: Everyone loves <fex>compliments</fex>.
The delight <fex>on her face</fex> was mixed with asonishment.
Mr. Whiskers was upset <fex>about his cat treats</fex>.
Tracy was in an irritated <fex>mood</fex>.
It felt pretty awkward to partake in such a nervous <fex>ceremony</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex>, Bob was still interested in the young Republicans.
She's a <fex>French</fex> Teacher
She's Studying <fex>for a Master's degree</fex>
Taut with worry, Dad taught us <fex>how to drive</fex>.
My brother taught me <fex>not to be mean to guys when I'm not interested in them</fex>.
When I was two she taught me <fex>that a quarter was 25 cents and a dime was 10 cents</fex>.
All employees have received <fex>a booklet</fex> INSTRUCTING them on how to report ` anything from unwanted touching and uncalled-for blue jokes to overt demands for sexual favours . '
When his father died he went to live with an uncle in Ka'u who trained him <fex>as a warrior</fex> during his teenage years
.<fex>Alex and Zach Swindle</fex>, Centre, visited their brother in San Francisco in June and remembered to take along a copy of The Post>.
This time we remembered <fex>to turn the gas off before leaving</fex>.
We piled into the taxi and right when we were about to leave, I realized we forgot <fex>the video camera</fex>
He remembered <fex>afterwards</fex> to kiss her fingers.
I will truly miss Delmar and <fex>I</fex> will always remember when his eyes lit up everytime he got ice-cream.
today I saw a sister's exclassmate, and didn't recognise him, I remember <fex>him</fex> taller.
I can still remember <fex>saying the pledge every morning before class in elementary school</fex>, a rare occurrence among elementary school kids nowadays.
I remember Peter <fex>as immensely kind in those first three weeks before I was packed off to boarding school</fex>.
Atulprasad is principally remembered <fex>as a musician and composer</fex>.
I 'll <fex>never</fex> forget being in hospital
<fex>Marcel</fex> was sure that she had seen Eldridge on the balcony.
She talked of quests , of finding this absurd religious character , but he was unsure <fex>of her conviction</fex>.
I am sure <fex>that we'll arrive on time</fex>.
She caught sight of her mother's dubious <fex>expression</fex>.
I bet <fex>Johno</fex> can remember the name of the Ramones' drummer.
Do you remember <fex>how to spell cupboard ?</fex>
<fex>Afterwards</fex>, I forgot what I was pissed off about, but I was.
